summary: The Security Council, recalling its previous resolutions and statements, determines that the situation in South Sudan continues to threaten international peace and security. Acting under Chapter VII of the UN Charter, it decides to extend the mandate of UNMISS, as set out in resolution 2327 (2016), until 15 March 2018, and authorizes UNMISS to use all necessary means to carry out its tasks. The Council also decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
